body.p:
New Liberty April 26 1861
To his Excelency B Magoffin

In Belieiving that we will Ere long be called to act in defence of our People and State, I therefore tender you my Servises as Surgeon to Army Post that I may be assingned and will be ready when called for.. Accept my high esteem and believe me your friend

To his Excelency B Magoffin
Govenor of Kentucky

Dr Hughs is a Genteman with whom I am well acquainted and can most cordially recommend ^him^ to the position He asks. should he be accepted I should be very Glad to
have him attached to the Ohio River batalion to which I belong with hig esteem

Yours Respectfully
A W. Holeman
comm

New Liberty
Dr Wm Huges
Ans Jas W Tate
answer the Cols of Regiment appointmt have no authority --
